title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk on Friday, 5 February 2016 - BBC News
summary: sperm whale stranded at old hunstanton dies .
investigation into whale strandings 'could take months ' .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for this week 's norfolk live .
we 'll be back on monday morning from 08:00 , and hope you 'll join us then .

documents.title: watch : norfolk and suffolk devolution hangs in balance
text: norfolk and suffolk insist they 're still committed to devolution for east anglia , despite being rebuffed by cambridgeshire .
i 've learned mps have been trying to persuade the three counties to form a combined authority .
there 's more on bbc1 at 11:00 on sunday on sunday politics east .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: overnight weather : mostly cloudy and mild
text: tonight will be mostly cloudy and mild with a chance of some patchy light rain at times .
minimum temperature 8c ( 46f ) .
saturday will be mostly cloudy and windy , with a band of more persistent rain edging in from the west at times .
top temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .

documents.title: dumper truck rampage in numbers
text: nicholas churchill , 40 , from brandon , left a trail of destruction when he took a 20-tonne dumper truck from his employer , while working at a quarry near spixworth , norwich , on 20 july last year .

documents.title: ambulance service sees a spike in 999 calls over january
text: the county 's ambulance service says it has had its busiest january on record with a 12 % increase in calls across the region .
in norfolk and cambridgeshire the figures were even higher with a 16 % increase in calls .

the east of england ambulance service says despite the increase in demand , it reached more patients with potentially life-threatening conditions in eight minutes , but is urging the public to think carefully before dialling 999 as it 's for emergency situations only .

documents.title: owner ordered to destroy four dogs which killed chihuahuas
text: a dog owner from king 's lynn has been ordered to have her four dogs destroyed after they killed two chihuahuas .
jean tuck was with her chihuahuas in the walks in king 's lynn when they were attacked and killed in december by four staffordshire bull terrier-type dogs belonging to dawn jackson .

jackson admitted to king 's lynn magistrates that her staffordshire bull terriers had carried out the attack and was given a suspended six-week prison sentence and banned from keeping dogs for two years .
author: Kate Scotter
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: dumper truck rampage : catalogue of destruction
text: nicholas churchill went on a two-hour rampage in the stolen dumper truck on july 20 last year .
during the ensuing police chase he :

documents.title: dumper truck rampage : police officer was 'petrified '
text: police who tried to stop 40-year-old nicholas churchill as he left a trail of destruction in a stolen dumper truck said they were `` petrified '' by his actions .

churchill , who admitted dangerous driving , aggravated vehicle-taking and driving while unfit through drugs , was jailed for 14 months at norwich crown court , and banned from driving for two years .

an officer who was inside one of the police cars rammed by the truck , said in a statement read to the court : `` i thought i was going to die , i was petrified and never felt anything like this before in my career i believe the vehicle was so large and heavy it could have driven over our police car . ''
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dumper truck driver tailed by six police cars and helicopter
text: nicholas churchill , who has today been jailed for 14 months and banned from driving for two years , was followed by six police cars and a helicopter for two hours over more 37 miles ( 60km ) across norfolk and suffolk in the stolen dumper truck .
the prosecution said after driving around the norwich ring road , forcing cars to swerve out of his way , churchill headed to the a11 dual carriageway .
shoppers scattered as his truck careered down a high street and over a pedestrianised square before coming to a halt near his home in brandon .
author: Philippa Taylor
BBC Local Live

documents.title: boss told dumper truck driver 'go home if you do n't like it ' - so he did
text: nicholas churchill , jailed for 14 months for going on a 37-mile ( 60km ) rampage in a stolen dumper truck and leaving a trail of destruction in his wake , had a `` red mist '' descend on him , his barrister told norwich crown court .

lindsay cox said , in mitigation : `` it may not have been hot that day but it had been a period of very hot weather and the defendant , for what 's it worth , had repeatedly expressed dissatisfaction at doing hot work in the hot cab of this vehicle .
`` he was effectively told 'like it or lump it ; carry on working or go home ' and the red mist descended . ''
churchill 's journey was finally halted near his home in brandon , suffolk .
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dumper truck rampage 'a shocking piece of sustained dangerous driving '
text: the judge sentencing 40-year-old nicholas churchill , who admitted stealing a dumper truck and going on a 37-mile rampage while high on amphetamines , described the incident as a `` trail of destruction . ''

at norwich crown court , judge anthony bate sentenced churchill , who had already admitted dangerous driving , aggravated vehicle-taking and driving while unfit through drugs , to 14 months in prison and banned him from driving for two years .
he said : `` you left a trail of destruction and damaged police vehicles in your wake .
it was a shocking piece of sustained dangerous driving . ''
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dumper truck driver 'put lives of public and police at risk ' , says prosecutor
text: the prosecutor in the case of nicholas churchill , 40 , from brandon , who stole a dumper truck and left a 37-mile ( 60km ) trail of destruction during a police chase across two counties , described the truck as `` a dangerous vehicle to be driven on public roads . ''
during sentencing at norwich crown court , andrew oliver added : `` it caused massive disruption and a massive involvement by norfolk and suffolk police .
he put the lives of members of the public and police officers at risk . ''
churchill was jailed for 14 months and banned from driving for two years .
author: Philippa Taylor
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : mild and windy with odd patches of rain
text: wind will strengthen throughout the afternoon with patches of drizzle .
temperatures around 11c ( 52f ) .
bbc weather has more details .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: le strange family responsible for removing whale off old hunstaton beach
text: the responsibility for removing a dead beached whale from the old hunstanton shoreline has fallen to one of norfolk 's oldest families .
king 's lynn & west norfolk borough council says it 's offered advice and support to landowner the le strange family .
history dictates the head of the le strange family may claim possession of anything on the beach or in the sea for 'as far as a man riding a horse can throw a spear ' .

documents.title: headlines : driver jailed after dumper truck rampage post-mortem samples taken from dead whale at old hunstanton
text: the main news stories this afternoon :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: watch : dumper truck driver rams police cars on 30-mile rampage
text: police have released footage of nicholas churchill 's 30-mile-plus dumper truck rampage , during which he rammed three police cars on a journey from spixworth , near norwich , to brandon in suffolk .
churchill , 40 , has just been jailed for 14 months and banned from driving for two years .
he admitted aggravated vehicle-taking and dangerous driving , and driving while unfit through drugs .

documents.title: dumper truck rampage driver receives driving ban
text: as well as a prison sentence , nicholas churchill has also received a driving ban :
in addition churchill banned from driving for 2 years .
judge commended bravery of norfolk police officers involved

documents.title: dumper truck rampage : 'red mist ' descended on driver
text: the latest from norwich crown court , where nicholas churchill has just been jailed for 14 months over his dumper truck rampage :
churchill 's defence lawyer says in mitigation `` the red mist descended .
what happened after that he ca n't remember or explain '' # dumpertruck

documents.title: breakingdumper truck rampage driver jailed for 14 months
text: nicholas churchill has been jailed at norwich crown court :
nicholas churchill sentenced to 14 months after going on 2 hour rampage in dumper truck across norfolk & suffolk
@ twitterid @ twitterid is that the one near snetterton ?
he driver should have been charged with attempted murder , the police car was a mess
@ twitterid 14 months is that all .

documents.title: dumper truck sentencing : court hears of two-hour rampage
text: in july last year , 40-year-old nicholas churchill set off in his 20-tonne dumper truck from spixworth quarry near norwich , following a row with his boss over the air conditioning in his cab .
for more than 30 miles ( 48km ) he evaded capture on the a11 and through thetford forest , driving at speeds of up to 30mph , repeatedly ramming police cars that were trying to stop him .
one officer said : `` i thought i was going to die .
i was petrified . ''
when he reached brandon , where he lives , the 40-year-old turned into a pedestrian precinct , sending people running for cover .
churchill earlier admitted dangerous driving and driving under the influence of drugs .
sentencing is continuing this lunchtime .
author: Alex Dunlop
BBC Look East

documents.title: dumper truck pursuit : driver caused more than £ 26,000 in damage
text: norwich crown court has been hearing that nicholas churchill , 40 , caused £ 26,000 of damage while behind the wheel of the dumper truck .
prosecution say churchill caused more than £ 26,000 of damage to 3 police cars and the truck he was driving .
# dumpertruck

documents.title: dumper truck pursuit : sentencing under way
text: more from the sentencing of a dumper truck driver who went on a rampage through norfolk and into suffolk .
norfolk pc : `` i thought i was going to die .
i was petrified '' as truck driven by nicholas churchill rams his police car # dumpertruck

documents.title: dumper truck pursuit : sentencing begins
text: look east 's alex dunlop is at norwich crown court where nicholas churchill , 40 , is being sentenced over dangerous driving in a dumper truck .
churchill has previously admitted dangerous driving and being under the influence of drugs .
court being shown incredible footage of dumper truck being pursued by police - trail of destruction as it repeatedly rams police cars on a11

documents.title: watch : why do whales get stranded ?
text: the sperm whale that has died after beaching at old hunstanton is the sixth to die on the east coast in the past fortnight , and the 29th to have beached in europe over the same period .
here 's a short video explaining why it happens .

documents.title: test get under way on latest dead whale
text: tests on the dead whale beached at old hunstanton are being carried out in the wider context of the european situation '' , according to marine scientist rob deaville .
this is now the 29th sperm whale that 's died around the .
north sea so it 's a hugely abnormal event , '' he said .

in the coming weeks and months we 'll be working very closely with our german , dutch and french colleagues about gathering data , about what might have been going on in the north atlantic to potentially bring them into the north sea , '' said mr deaville .

documents.title: watch : whale beaching could indicate 'systemic ' problem
text: the beaching of a sixth sperm whale on the east coast is part of a worrying trend , according to a scientist .

rob deaville , expert on whale strandings , said if the whale was not part of the same pod found beached across europe recently then this would be more concerning , as it could indicate `` a systemic problem out there in the north atlantic . ''

documents.title: watch : scene at old hunstanton beach after whale 's death
text: despite efforts made to save the sperm whale which beached at old hunstanton yesterday , it died at about 20:00 .
the 14m-long ( 46ft ) bull was found about two miles from where another sperm whale died on 22 january .

documents.title: whale : latest from the scene
text: this is the scene at old hunstanton beach this morning as experts examine the corpse of the whale , which died at about 20:00 last night .

documents.title: death of whale 'probably best outcome '
text: rob deaville , of the uk cetacean strandings investigation programme , said the death of the sperm whale that beached at old hunstanton yesterday was `` probably the best outcome '' for its welfare .
he said : `` no doubt it probably was suffering on shore , but it was probably very compromised by being stranded for such a long time .
`` there would be no chance of being refloated or rescued , which is what a lot of people hoped would happen - and it would n't have been a good outcome here .
`` so probably the best outcome in terms of the welfare of the whale is that it died fairly quickly . ''

documents.title: samples to be collected from beached sperm whale
text: samples will be collected this morning from the sperm whale that died at old hunstanton last night .
the whale was the second to have washed up there - and the 29th to have beached in europe in recent weeks .
rob deaville , of the uk cetacean strandings investigation programme , said : `` it was quite an emotional impact , going through the night and this dim shape appeared out of the gloom .
you got closer and closer and there was this whale , lying on its side on the sand it had been alive just an hour earlier . ''

documents.title: beached sperm whale dies at old hunstanton
text: a sperm whale washed up on the beach in old hunstanton has died , despite efforts from divers trying to save it .
the sperm whale died at about 20:00 last night and is believed to have been from the same pod as five others that beached and died in the wash last month .
marine biologists will carry out tests to try to establish what went wrong .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: weather : mild but turning windy
text: a mild day but cloudy with some patchy drizzle with winds really up this afternoon .
temperatures around 11c ( 52f ) .
weather has more details .

documents.title: hello and welcome to norfolk live
text: between now and 18:00 , the team here will bring you the news , sport , travel and weather updates as we get them .
we 're always interested in what 's happening in your part of norfolk .
if there 's anything you wish to share with us you can contact us on email , facebook or twitter .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live
